roleset.name: to be or come into opposition, to come into conflict, be in opposition

role.descr: agentive clasher, or all clashers in one constituent

example.name: conflict-v: transitive
example.text: As discussed in the context of controlling federal spending , the line - item veto is characterized as a way for the president to excise perfectly constitutional provisions in a spending bill that are objectionable merely because they conflict with his policy objectives .

example.name: conflictive-j
example.text: In our thought faith , problems to deal with are very complex , wider and more conflictive .

example.name: conflict-n: Args 1 & 2
example.text: He was prepared to risk a conflict with the U.S. over an Egyptian plan to hold direct Israeli - Palestinian talks , which the premier 's Likud bloc opposes .

propbank.arg: over an Egyptian plan to hold direct Israeli - Palestinian talks , which the premier 's Likud bloc opposes

example.name: conflict-n: Arg1 & TMP
example.text: I 've got a schedule conflict on Tuesday , so I 'll have to cancel our meeting .

example.name: conflict-n: Arg2
example.text: My wife and I came into conflict about what to name the baby .

propbank.arg: about what to name the baby

example.name: conflict-n: Args 1 & 2
example.text: The property conflict with my neighbor lasted three years , until he took me to court .

example.name: conflict-n: Arg0 as one constituent
example.text: The new law has set off the familiar conflict between Democrats and Republicans .

example.name: conflict-n: All arguments
example.text: Demeter 's refusal to eat or feed the world until the other gods resolved her conflict with Hades over Persephone brought on winter .

roleset.note: CONFLICT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'conflict' based on WSJ; adjectival 'conflictive' based on BOLT-7. Member of VNcls battle-36.4-1. (from conflict.01-v)
CONFLICTIVE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from conflictive.01-j)
CONFLICTED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from conflicted.01-j)
